darija_ar: واش غادي دير راسك أنّاك ماكنتيش كادّير داكشي لي كنتي كادّير هاد تلت سنين لي دووزتها معاك ف لعيلاج?

english: You're putting me in a difficult position.
When I listen to you and I talk to you, it's for your psychological balance, because it's my job.
darija: fach kantSenneT lik o kanhder m3ak, rah 3la 9bel attawazon annafsi dialk, 7it hadi khdmti.
darija_ar: فاش كانتصنّط ليك أُ كانهدر معاك, راه علا قبل أتّاوازون أنّافسي ديالك, حيت هادي خدمتي.

english: Have you just been playing with me all this time?
darija: wach kenti katl3b bia had lw9t kaml?
darija_ar: واش كنتي كاتلعب بيا هاد لوقت كامل?

english: PRETENDING to want to know how my day was, how I felt, what I was looking for in life?

darija_ar: كاتمتّل أنّاك باغي تعرف كيداز نهاري, كي كانحسّ, علاياش كانقلّب ف لحايات?

english: It's not a game, that's how therapy happens.

darija_ar: ماشي كانلعب, راه هاكّا كايكون لعيلاج أنّافسي.

english: Look, I think you should think about what you want from your psychiatrist.

darija_ar: سمعي, كانضن أنّاهو خاصّ تفكري أشنو بغيتي من عند طبيب نفسي ديالك.

english: Maybe you should go to therapy with another psychiatrist.

darija_ar: يمكن خاصّك تمشي تعالجي عند شي طبيب نفسي أخور.

english: Because now I feel, in your mind, things are different from what they should be to make this happen.
darija: 7it kan7ess, anna f dmaghk, l omor mkhtalfa 3la kifach khaSSha tkon bach ykhdm had l3ilaj.
darija_ar: حيت كانحسّ, أنّا ف دماغك, ل أُمور مختالفا علا كيفاش خاصّها تكون باش يخدم هاد لعيلاج.

darija: Hah-- rah kanmchi 3nd wa7d Tbib nfsi akhor!
darija_ar: هاه-- راه كانمشي عند واحد طبيب نفسي أخور!

english: You think you're so smart... playing with me all this time... I HATE you...

darija_ar: كايحساب ليك راسك دكي... كاتلعب بيا هاد لمودّا كاملا... كان كرهك...

english: I think we're going to end this meeting now.
darija: kayban lia nsaliw had lli9a2 daba.
darija_ar: كايبان ليا نساليو هاد الليقاء دابا.

english: By the way, it's time for my next patient.

darija_ar: بل موناسابا, جا لوقت ديال لمريض الجاي ديالي.

english: No not all, it looks very creepy!
No I dont have a compass or a map.
darija: lla ma3ndi la bawSala la khariTa.
darija_ar: اللا ماعندي لا باوصالا لا خاريطا.

Let's try going back the way we came
I thought you were taking the compass...
darija_ar: حساب ليا راه خديتي معاك لباوصالا...

english: It's got GPS, it doesn't need a connection.
No, you said you were taking the compass.

darija_ar: اللا, ڭولتي غادي تاخد معاك لباوصالا.

english: We'll have to hurry, it's getting dark already

darija_ar: غادي يخصنا نزربو, بدا كايطيح ضلام

english: No, if you have the map we could see if there is a shorter route out of here.

english: It will take us hours to get back the way we came, in the dark, and through all that mud ...
darija: ghadi ykhSona sway3 bach nrj3o mnin jina, f DDlam, o f wsT ga3 had lghiss ...
darija_ar: غادي يخصونا سوايع باش نرجعو منين جينا, ف الضلام, أُ ف وسط ڭاع هاد لغيسّ ...

english: Sure, with the rain from this morning, the ground is very muddy.

darija_ar: بسّاح, معا هاد شتا ديال هاد صباح, لرض مغييسّا.

english: But without a compass it's hard to know which way to return even with the map.

darija_ar: والاكين بلا باوصالا سعيب تعرف منين ترجع واخا بل خاريطا.

english: But since we're from the south, I think we'll get through this...

english: Then we may be able to see the road or the village from the top.
darija: o ghadi ymken tchouf Tri9 wla lvilaj men lfo9.

english: Once we rach the road it will be easy.

english: Going up on that hill will give us the right visibility and the village will be lit up so we can spot him easily to go in the right direction.

darija_ar: إلا طلعنا ف هاد لهاضابا غادي تولي عندنا شوفا مزيانا أُ ل ڤيلاج أيكون مضووّي إدان غادي نشوفوه ب سوهولا باش نعرفو ل إتّيجاه لي أنمشيو فيه.

darija_ar: إلا لقينا لحجر غادي نكونو فلبلاصا لموناسّيبا

english: I'm not sure I want to throw up rocks.
I agree, throwing rocks around will get us nowhere.

darija_ar: متافق, زفّان بلحجر ماغادي يدّينا ل تا بلاصا.

english: We need to save our energy for the climb and the long walk down.

english: But anyway, it's nice we almost got to the village.

english: You look a little worried, are you ok?

darija_ar: كاتبان شويا فشكل, واش نتا بيخير?

english: I don't like to fly at all on bad weather like today.

darija_ar: ماكايعجبنيش نطير ڭاع فاش يكون لجوو خايب بحال ليوما.

english: It is difficult but you ve listened to all the instructions from the crew so you have done everything you can

I know it is difficult for you as fear and logic don't always go hand in hand

darija_ar: عرفت أنّاها سعيبا ب نيسبا ليك حيت لخلعا أُ لوجيك ماكايتجمعوش عاداتان

english: Yes, actually the logic would want us to get in the head that the plane is the safest transport.

english: Or why don't you suggest something

english: But tell me, you don't seem very stressed.

english: Do you travel for your work or a tourist?

english: After our game maybe we should both have a drink and try to sleep

Maybe we should just sleep, bye for now

english: Yes, a good cup of coffee will do me great.

english: Come on, let's start the game.
Fatima, please let me worry about it, I want to rest.

english: Let's go for a walk and climb that hill over there.

I can't just lie by the pool.

I will only stay quiet for 20 minutes.

english: Yeah, yeah, we spent three hours at the pool.

english: No no, I don't want to go alone, it's absurd.

english: But once again, when you want to do different things, you end up doing whatever you want.

english: I feel like you don't give a shit about my mind.

english: Well now I can't relax knowing you're unhappy.

english: Who's the wise man of the woods?
Well he probably doesn't exist but at least we would be up a mountain looking for him instead of having this stupid argument.

english: Thank you for listening to me for once!

english: I think I need to see a doctor
